title: Heart Rhythm Explorers: Classifying Arrhythmias Through Active Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Microlearning sessions (3 times/week, 15 minutes) in a BYOD environment. Case-based learning utilizing virtual patient data

learning_goals: Learners can classify five basic heart rhythms from ECG signal patterns with 80% accuracy.
Learners can design an experiment to improve data labeling efficiency by 40% using active learning strategies.
Through team-based projects, learners classify real ICD data samples and map the medical AI learning process.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
